title: Engagement Ceremony with borrowed ring
vignette: A man gives a ring borrowed from the bride herself to effect betrothal ceremony.

options.text: Invalid unless she gifts the ring first.
Valid if she knowingly accepts it.

title: Engagement Ceremony via messenger
vignette: The groom sends an agent with money and words of engagement ceremony instead of going himself.

options.text: Agency works; they are engaged.
Only personal delivery forms a bond.

title: Conditional betrothal ceremony on wealth
vignette: He says: be engaged to me on condition I am wealthy, though he isn't.

options.text: Void if the condition proves false.
Still valid once she accepts.

title: Engaging an underage girl
vignette: A father marries off his young daughter before she reaches maturity.

options.text: Permitted with the father's consent.
Wrong; wait until she is grown.

title: Stolen money for betrothal ceremony
vignette: The groom secretly uses stolen cash to engage a woman.

options.text: Invalid until he returns the theft and uses his own.
Still effective despite the wrongdoing.

title: Father accepts betrothal ceremony without daughter's consent
vignette: The father agrees to the match though his adult daughter objects.

options.text: Her consent is required; engagement ceremony fails.
His parental authority suffices.

title: Worthless item as engagement ceremony money
vignette: He gives her a token worth less than a small coin when saying the formula.

options.text: Not valid; value must meet the minimum.
Value doesn't matter if she agrees.

title: Delayed effect betrothal ceremony
vignette: He says she will be engaged to him after thirty days and she accepts now.

options.text: It takes effect after the set time.
It is immediate regardless of delay.

title: Second man engages during waiting period
vignette: Before the thirty days pass, another suitor engages her with her consent.

options.text: The second betrothal ceremony prevails.
The first man's claim stands until the time passes.

title: Using a forgiven loan as consideration
vignette: The groom says the money she owes him is now for betrothal ceremony instead of repayment.

options.text: Not valid; a loan cannot serve as the money.
Valid if she agrees to that arrangement.

title: Proxy delivering the ring
vignette: Both sides send representatives to enact the betrothal ceremony with a ring.

options.text: Agents may perform all parts for them.
At least one party must be present.

title: Woman engages a man
vignette: She hands him money saying "Be my husband".

options.text: Does not take effect; only men engage.
Valid if he accepts.

title: Non-member ring
vignette: The ring used for betrothal ceremony was made from related to idol worship imagery.

options.text: Unfit; select a different ring.
It still works despite its origin.

title: Engagement Ceremony through teaching foundational document
vignette: Instead of money, he offers to teach her foundational document as consideration for marriage.

options.text: Knowledge cannot substitute for money or item.
If she values it, the betrothal ceremony is valid.

title: Reusing a ring from a broken engagement
vignette: He had previously engaged another woman with this ring but the engagement was canceled.

options.text: He may reuse it without issue.
It carries bad associations; choose a new ring.
